text:
“I’ve been shedding tears since your father’s death,” Pulcheria said. 

Raskolnikov looked down. “I was in the rain yesterday, mother…”

“No, no,” she interrupted. “I understand now. I won’t cross-question you.” 

She paced, her hands wringing. “I read your article three times. Dmitri brought it to me.”

“Show me, mother.” 

He took the magazine, feeling a strange mix of pride and sorrow.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's mother expresses her understanding of his complex thoughts and plans while reflecting on her emotional state since his father's death.
